text: [Music]
hi I'm Ron Cully principal product
manager with AWS if you're moving your
ad dependent workloads to the AWS cloud
they'll need access to a domain
controllers also called DCs and if you
want to use AWS solutions like Amazon
workspaces with your ad credentials
you'll need a way to connect those
solutions to your ad infrastructure AWS
directory service for Microsoft Active
Directory also known as AWS managed my
croissant ad can help this AWS managed
service provides domain controllers that
run on actual Microsoft Windows server
by default you get two DCs for high
availability each runs in a separate
availability zone and are reachable by
applications running in your V PC you
can add DC's to increase availability
even more or to increase transaction
rates the directory you create is yours
exclusively no other customer has access
to your DC's the services compliance
audited so it's eligible to support your
FedRAMP PCI HIPAA or Sauk audited
application amazon provides the
operational management including
deployment monitoring patching instance
rotation snapshot and restore you
administer users and configure features
including password policies scale-out
and AD trusts the standard edition
offers one gigabyte of customer usable
storage for objects and scripts
Enterprise Edition offers 17 gigabytes
creating your directory is a snap sign
into the AWS management console go to
the security identity and compliance
section and select directory service
choose setup directory and select AWS
managed Microsoft ad select the Edition
you want to use enter the fully
qualified domain name for your AWS
managed Microsoft ad forest next enter a
password for your admin account
select the Amazon VPC in which you want
the directory installed confirm the
details of your configuration and choose
create directory it takes about 45
minutes for the directory to come up
within your directory AWS creates an
organizational unit and delegates your
admin account permissions to control
that o you you can add users groups
computers policies and other OU's you
can also make schema modifications AWS
retains the domain administrator account
for its exclusive use to perform
operational management let's look at
some of the use cases for the directory
first you can join ec2 instances to your
AWS managed Microsoft ad domain and use
Group Policy objects to manage your
instances then you can run a tea
dependent applications such as
SharePoint or dotnet applications on the
instances you can also use the directory
from compatible AWS managed applications
and services for example you can join
Amazon relational database service for
Microsoft sequel server to the directory
to support Windows integrated
authentication you can join Amazon
workspaces for virtual desktop
infrastructure in the AWS cloud Amazon
quick site can use the directory to
share business intelligence dashboards
with other people in the directory for a
complete list of compatible Amazon
applications
check out the directory services website
with standard tools like Active
Directory users and computers many
customers create users in AWS managed
Microsoft ad as their standalone
directory in the AWS cloud these users
can then access 80 dependent workloads
that are running on ec2 instances and
compatible AWS applications to services
with users in AWS managed Microsoft ad
you have the option to use Azure ad
connect with pass-through authentication
to Azure ad this enables your office 365
users to authenticate with their AWS
managed my croissant ad credentials
advanced organizations can even use
Active Directory Federation service for
applications alternatively you can use
AWS single sign-on to enable your users
to sign into the AWS management console
and a variety of web applications such
as office 365 G suite box and Salesforce
but maybe you have an existing ad
deployment in your data center or on ec2
in a V PC with AWS manage my croissant
ad you can extend that infrastructure
with AD trust and reduce the footprint
of AD infrastructure you manage without
synchronizing identities your users can
access Amazon applications and get the
familiar Windows single sign-on
experience with applications in the AWS
cloud they can even sign into web
applications through AWS SSO with their
existing ad credentials thanks for
joining us to learn how to create an AWS
managed Microsoft ad directory and about
some of the important use cases for more
information visit our web site and be
sure to watch the video how to
administer your AWS Microsoft managed ad
you
